member.summary: Cancel order by client order id
member.param: Symbol, for example "HYPE/USDC" for spot, or "ETH" for futures

member.name: M:HyperLiquid.Net.Interfaces.Clients.BaseApi.IHyperLiquidRestClientTrading.CancelOrdersByClientOrderIdAsync(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{HyperLiquid.Net.Objects.Models.HyperLiquidCancelByClientOrderIdRequest},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Cancel multiple orders by client order id

member.param: Symbol name, for example "HYPE/USDC" for spot, or "ETH" for futures
Limit price. For market orders pass the current price of the symbol for max slippage calculation.
Client order id, an optional 128 bit hex string, e.g. 0x1234567890abcdef1234567890abcdef

member.name: M:HyperLiquid.Net.Interfaces.Clients.BaseApi.IHyperLiquidRestClientTrading.PlaceMultipleOrdersAsync(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{HyperLiquid.Net.Objects.Models.HyperLiquidOrderRequest},System.Nullable{HyperLiquid.Net.Enums.TpSlGrouping},System.String,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Place multiple new orders in a single call

member.param: Symbol name, for example "HYPE/USDC" for spot, or "ETH" for futures
Limit price. For market orders pass the current price of the symbol for max slippage calculation.
Client order id, an optional 128 bit hex string, e.g. 0x1234567890abcdef1234567890abcdef

member.name: M:HyperLiquid.Net.Interfaces.Clients.BaseApi.IHyperLiquidRestClientTrading.CancelAfterAsync(System.Nullable{System.TimeSpan},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Cancel all orders after the provided timeout has passed. Can be called at an interval to act as deadman switch. Pass null to cancel an existing timeout. This will cancel both Spot and Futures orders. This functionality is only available after achieving a certain trading volume.
member.param: Timeout after which to cancel all order, or null to cancel the countdown
Edit order by order id, either this or clientOrderId should be provided
Edit order by client order id, either this or orderId should be provided
Symbol name, for example "HYPE/USDC" for spot, or "ETH" for futures
The new client order id, an optional 128 bit hex string, e.g. 0x1234567890abcdef1234567890abcdef

member.summary: Edit multiple orders in a single call

member.summary: Send usd to another address. This transfer does not touch the EVM bridge.

member.summary: Send spot assets to another address. This transfer does not touch the EVM bridge.

member.name: M:HyperLiquid.Net.Interfaces.Clients.SpotApi.IHyperLiquidRestClientSpotApiAccount.WithdrawAsync(System.String,System.Decimal,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Initiate the withdrawal flow. After making this request, the L1 validators will sign and send the withdrawal request to the bridge contract. There is a $1 fee for withdrawing at the time of this writing and withdrawals take approximately 5 minutes to finalize.

member.name: M:HyperLiquid.Net.Interfaces.Clients.SpotApi.IHyperLiquidRestClientSpotApiAccount.TransferInternalAsync(HyperLiquid.Net.Enums.TransferDirection,System.Decimal,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Transfer USD between Spot and Futures account

member.name: M:HyperLiquid.Net.Interfaces.Clients.SpotApi.IHyperLiquidRestClientSpotApiAccount.WithdrawFromStakingAsync(System.Int64,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Withdraw from staking into the user's spot account. Note that transfers from staking to spot account go through a 7 day unstaking queue.

member.name: M:HyperLiquid.Net.Interfaces.Clients.SpotApi.IHyperLiquidRestClientSpotApiAccount.DelegateOrUndelegateStakeFromValidatorAsync(HyperLiquid.Net.Enums.DelegateDirection,System.String,System.Int64,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Delegate or undelegate native tokens to or from a validator. Note that delegations to a particular validator have a lockup duration of 1 day.
member.param: Validator address in hex format, for example 0x0000000000000000000000000000000000000000

member.name: M:HyperLiquid.Net.Interfaces.Clients.SpotApi.IHyperLiquidRestClientSpotApiAccount.ApproveBuilderFeeAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Approve a builder address of the library to charge the fee percentage as defined in the BuilderFeePercentage client options field

member.name: M:HyperLiquid.Net.Interfaces.Clients.SpotApi.IHyperLiquidRestClientSpotApiAccount.ApproveBuilderFeeAsync(System.String,System.Decimal,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Approve a builder address to charge a certain fee
member.param: The address of the builder in hex format, for example 0x0000000000000000000000000000000000000000
Max fee percentage the builder can charge

member.name: P:HyperLiquid.Net.Objects.Options.HyperLiquidOrderBookOptions.Limit
member.summary: The top amount of results to keep in sync. If for example limit=10 is used, the order book will contain the 10 best bids and 10 best asks. Leaving this null will sync the full order book

member.name: P:HyperLiquid.Net.Objects.Options.HyperLiquidOrderBookOptions.InitialDataTimeout
member.summary: After how much time we should consider the connection dropped if no data is received for this time after the initial subscriptions

member.name: P:HyperLiquid.Net.Objects.Options.HyperLiquidRestOptions.BuilderFeePercentage
member.summary:
The builder fee percentage to apply to orders. This refers to a fee percentage being paid to the developer to support development. Defaults to null/0. Can be between 0.001% and 0.1%.
If set to a non-null value the address has to be whitelisted using restClient.SpotApi.Account.ApproveBuilderFeeAsync

member.name: M:HyperLiquid.Net.SymbolOrderBooks.HyperLiquidOrderBookFactory.#ctor(System.IServiceProvider)
member.param: Service provider for resolving logging and clients

member.name: T:HyperLiquid.Net.SymbolOrderBooks.HyperLiquidSymbolOrderBook
member.summary: Implementation for a synchronized order book. After calling Start the order book will sync itself and keep up to date with new data. It will automatically try to reconnect and resync in case of a lost/interrupted connection. Make sure to check the State property to see if the order book is synced.
